content: Singaporean lawyer and businessman**This article has multiple issues.** Please help **improve it** or discuss these issues on the **talk page**. *(Learn how and when to remove these messages)*This biography of a living person **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help by adding reliable sources. Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced **must be removed immediately** from the article and its talk page, especially if potentially libelous. *Find sources:* "Syed Ahmad Alwee Alsree" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(April 2016)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*The topic of this article **may not meet Wikipedia's notability guideline for biographies**. Please help to demonstrate the notability of the topic by citing reliable secondary sources that are independent of the topic and provide significant coverage of it beyond a mere trivial mention. If notability cannot be shown, the article is likely to be merged, redirected, or deleted. *Find sources:* "Syed Ahmad Alwee Alsree" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(April 2016)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* [Datuk](/wiki/Malay_titles) [Syed](/wiki/Sayyid) **Ahmad Alwee Alsree** ([Arabic](/wiki/Arabic_language): سيد أحمد علوي السري **Saiyid Aḥmad Alawī al-sirī**) is the Group Executive Director of [Cahya Mata Sarawak Berhad](/wiki/Cahya_Mata_Sarawak_Berhad) (CMSB). He is married to [Hanifah Hajar Taib](/wiki/Hanifah_Hajar_Taib), the [Deputy Minister of Economy](/wiki/Minister_of_Economy_(Malaysia)), the [Member of Parliament](/wiki/Dewan_Rakyat) (MP) for [Mukah](/wiki/Mukah_(federal_constituency)) and the daughter of [Abdul Taib Mahmud](/wiki/Abdul_Taib_Mahmud), the former [Yang di-Pertua Negeri](/wiki/Yang_di-Pertua_Negeri_of_Sarawak) and former [Chief Minister of Sarawak](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Sarawak). He was originally from [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) but he has since moved to [Kuching](/wiki/Kuching) when he had earlier joined Cahya Mata Sarawak Berhad in February 2004 as Group [General Manager](/wiki/General_Manager) – [Human Resources](/wiki/Human_Resources). He was appointed as Group Executive Director of CMSB on 19 August 2008 following an earlier appointment as Deputy Group Managing Director in September 2006. Syed Ahmad had worked with his brother-in-law [Datuk Seri Sulaiman Abdul Rahman Taib](/wiki/Sulaiman_Abdul_Rahman_Taib). He is currently working with Mahmud Abu Bekir Taib, Sulaiman Taib's brother. He is now working as a director of Rashid Hussain Berhad ([RHB Bank](/wiki/RHB_Bank)), CMS Trust Management Berhad and CMS Works International Ltd. Syed Ahmad graduated with a [Bachelor of Law](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Law) (LL.B.) from the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore), and practised law in Singapore for over 10 years prior to joining CMS Group. Syed Ahmad received the honorary Panglima Jasa Negara (PJN) award which carries the title 'Datuk' from the [Yang di-Pertuan Agong](/wiki/Yang_di-Pertuan_Agong) [Tuanku Mizan Zainal Abidin](/wiki/Tuanku_Mizan_Zainal_Abidin) in conjunction with His Majesty's birthday on 12 November 2009. This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Syed Ahmad Alwee Alsree
